What is the difference between a moral principle and a moral rule?  Answer: A moral principle is a general statement that describes a moral value or rule. It is a broad guideline that can be applied to many different situations. A moral rule on the other hand is a specific guideline that applies to a particular situation. It is more specific than a principle and is often based on a principle.  ##
